originalTitle: At least 55 Ghanaians killed in Russia-Ukraine war, minister says
title: At least 55 Ghanaians killed in Russia-Ukraine war, minister says
content: This is the highest number of confirmed casualties from a single African country in the Ukraine-Russia war.

title: Former US diplomat sentenced to life for abusing two girls in Burkina Faso
content: He used the girls' mother's life-threatening illness as an opportunity to demand sex, said the US Office of Public Affairs.

originalTitle: Ukraine claws back southern territory as Russia’s war enters fifth year
title: Happy News from Ukraine: Sharing Land is Good!
content:
Hello, amazing friends! It's your kid-friendly news reporter here, bringing you news from far, far away. We live in a world with so many beautiful countries, just like our wonderful homes here in Africa. Each country has its own special land, like your own house has its own rooms and garden. Sometimes, though, countries don't agree on who owns which piece of land. This can make them have a big fight. We call this a war. It's like when you and your friend might argue over who gets to play with a toy, but much, much bigger. Wars are sad because people get hurt, and homes can be broken.

About Countries and Borders

Imagine you have a drawing on a big piece of paper. Each different color on the paper could be a different country. The lines between the colors are called "borders." Borders show us where one country ends and another begins. It’s like the fence around your compound or the wall between two houses – it helps everyone know whose space is whose. Ukraine and Russia are two countries very far away from us, in a part of the world called Europe. They are neighbours, just like some of your friends or family might live next door to you. For a while now, these two countries have been having a very big fight about some of their land. It's been going on for a long, long time. Did you know? The world has almost 200 different countries! Each one has its own special flag and its own way of saying hello. Like in Africa, where we have countries like Kenya, Nigeria, South Africa, and so many more!

Good News for Ukraine!

Now, for some good news! We heard that Ukraine, one of these countries, has been able to get some of its land back. Imagine if someone borrowed your favourite toy, and then you were able to get it back! That’s a bit like what happened. In the last few months, in December and February, Ukraine worked hard to take back pieces of land that had been taken by Russia. This is good news because it means that people who live in those areas can start to feel safer and maybe go back to their homes. When a country gets its land back, it's like putting a puzzle piece back in its right place. Everyone hopes it means more peace for the people living there.

What Does This Mean?

When Ukraine got some of its land back, it showed something important. It showed that the other country, Russia, wasn't as strong in its fighting as it was before. It's like when you play a game, and sometimes one team might not be playing their very best. This means that Ukraine was strong enough to get some of their homes and villages back. This is a big deal because it makes people hope that maybe, just maybe, this big fight can start to slow down. When one side shows they are strong, and the other side isn't as strong, it can sometimes lead to talks about stopping the fight. Did you know? Even when countries are having a big fight, many other countries around the world try to help them stop. They send special people to talk and try to find a way for everyone to live in peace.

Why Sharing is Important

Here in Africa, we know how important it is to share and live together. We have so many different tribes and people, and we all try to live as good neighbours. When countries fight over land, it makes everyone sad. It's much better when countries respect each other's borders and live peacefully. This news about Ukraine getting some land back reminds us that even during big fights, there can be good steps forward. It shows that people are still trying to make things right. It gives hope that one day soon, the fighting will stop completely, and everyone can go back to living happily in their own homes.

Wishing for Peace

Many children in Ukraine have had to leave their homes because of this big fight. They miss their friends, their schools, and their toys. When land is returned, it brings a little bit of hope that these children might be able to go back to their normal lives. Just like we love peace and quiet in our own homes, every country wants peace. We hope that Ukraine and Russia will find a way to stop fighting and share the world peacefully. This small step of Ukraine getting some land back is a tiny step towards that big, beautiful dream of peace for everyone. Did you know? Many children around the world learn about peace in their schools. They learn to share, to be kind, and to solve problems with words, not with fights. This is a very important lesson for everyone, even countries! Let's all hope for peace and friendship for Ukraine and all the countries in the world. Thank you for listening, amazing friends!
summary: Ukraine, a country far away, has been able to get some of its land back from a big fight, showing that even tough situations can sometimes get better.
whyMatters: It is important because it means people in Ukraine might get to live more peacefully in their homes, and it reminds us that all countries should try to live together without fighting over land.

originalTitle: IAEA urges Iran to allow inspections, points at Isfahan
title: IAEA urges Iran to allow inspections, points at Isfahan
content: IAEA says Iran has stored most of its highly enriched uranium at an underground tunnel complex at its Isfahan facility.

originalTitle: Near-blind Rohingya refugee found dead after border patrol release
title: Near-blind Rohingya refugee found dead after border patrol release
content: Nurul Amin Shah Alam, a nearly-blind Rohingya refugee, was found dead days after US Border Patrol agents released him.

content: The crowded tram was travelling in the centre of Milan at rush hour when it appeared to crash into the side of a building.

content: The latest attacks by Pakistan follow months of clashes between the two countries. despite agreeing to a fragile ceasefire in October.

title: What we know after latest escalation in Pakistan-Afghanistan tensions
content: Bombings by Pakistan are the most significant development in tensions between the two neighbours - though the physical impact remains unclear.

title: Chelsea to face holders PSG in Champions League last 16
content: Chelsea will play holders Paris St-Germain in the Champions League last 16 while Manchester City will face Real Madrid in the knockout stages for a fifth straight season.

title: Gordon needs to stay 'fully focused' after Arsenal talk - Howe
content: Head coach Eddie Howe has urged Anthony Gordon to stay "fully focused" after the Newcastle United forward was linked with a move to Arsenal.

title: Messi tackled by pitch invader in Inter Miami game
content: Argentina captain Lionel Messi is hauled to the ground by a pitch invader during Inter Miami's friendly in Puerto Rico.
